result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Douglas Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: with any other sentence
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond Douglas Woods

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: added mandatory cost and DNA surcharge; nothing stated on the record as to being waived.

Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent with any other sentence with credit for 60 days time served.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Gregory A Renden in court, defendant Raymond Douglas Woods not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant not produced.  Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Per e-mail between this clerk, ADA Mathy and Attorney Renden, case is adjourned to 5-21-2014 at 8:30 a.m. for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
jad

Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 10.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess firearms/body armor.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Raymond Douglas Woods not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Renden states Br. 10 has accepted this case for disposition along with pending case.  Court allows case to be transferred to Br. 10 subject to the judge accepting the case.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Raymond Douglas Woods in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
